required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Salbutamol Use in Ozone Air Pollution by People With Asthma and/or Exercise Induced Bronchoconstriction (EIB)
clinical_study.official_title: Examining the Effect of Salbutamol Use in Asthma and/or Exercise Induced Bronchoconstriction Whilst Exercising in Ozone Air Pollution

brief_summary.textblock: Salbutamol use is increased in areas with high levels of ozone pollution and the potential consequences of this are not well known. The purpose of this study is to examine the effect of salbutamol on lung function and inflammation in people with asthma and/or EIB exercising in ozone air pollution. To examine this, we are planning a randomized cross over trial where people with asthma and/or EIB complete sub maximal exercise in four conditions on four separate days. The four condition are: ozone + salbutamol, filtered air + salbutamol, ozone + placebo medication, and filtered air + placebo medication.

study_design_info.masking_description: Drug condition (placebo or salbutamol) will be double blinded Air quality condition (ozone or filtered air) will be single blinded

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Fraction of exhaled nitric oxide (FeNO) from baseline to 30 minutes after exercise
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and 30 minutes after exercise in each condition

primary_outcome.measure: Change in FEV1 from baseline to 30 minutes after exercise
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and 30 minutes after exercise in each condition

primary_outcome.measure: Change in FVC from baseline to 30 minutes after exercise
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and 30 minutes after exercise in each condition

primary_outcome.measure: Change in FEF25-75 from baseline to 30 minutes after exercise
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and 30 minutes after exercise in each condition

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exercising in ozone following salbutamol inhalation
arm_group.description: Participants will be doing sub-maximal exercise (60% of VO2max for 30 minutes) on a cycle ergometer while inhaling 170ppb ozone after inhaling 200ug of salbutamol.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exercising in filtered air following salbutamol inhalation
arm_group.description: Participants will be doing sub-maximal exercise (60% of VO2max for 30 minutes) on a cycle ergometer while inhaling filtered air after inhaling 200ug of salbutamol.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exercising in ozone following placebo inhalation
arm_group.description: Participants will be doing sub-maximal exercise (60% of VO2max for 30 minutes) on a cycle ergometer while inhaling 170ppb ozone after inhaling placebo medication.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exercising in filtered air following placebo inhalation
arm_group.description: Participants will be doing sub-maximal exercise (60% of VO2max for 30 minutes) on a cycle ergometer while inhaling filtered after inhaling placebo medication.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have asthma and/or EIB
- Able to perform maximal exercise
- Able to communicate sufficiently using the English language
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergic to salbutamol (also known as Ventolin)
- Pregnant or potentially pregnant
- Have a history of smoking
- Had an upper respiratory tract infection within the last 4 weeks
- Have a chronic respiratory disease other than asthma or EIB

patient_data.ipd_description: Any data shared will not contain any personal identifiers.
